etymology.description: Pictogram: a hat — original form of 帽, in which it appears as ⺜.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a simple cap or hood covering the head, which naturally gives the meaning ‘hat.’ The form later fossilized as the component ⺜ in words like 帽 and appears within graphs such as 蒙, preserving the sense of covering.

examples.chinese: 我戴着帽子(我戴著帽子)。
这顶帽子很大(這頂帽子很大)。
他脱下帽子打招呼(他脫下帽子打招呼)。
examples.pinyin: Tā tuō xià màozi dǎ zhāohu.
examples.english: He took off his hat to greet.
